title: Conductors - how is sphere charge -Q distributed

content.question: A solid conducting sphere has a net negative charge <math alttext="negative Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>−</mo><mi>Q</mi></math>. Which of the following correctly indicates how the excess charge is distributed, and provides a valid justification?

choices.label: The excess charge is distributed on the surface of the sphere, because negatively charged particles’ mutual repulsion causes them to move to the surface.
The excess charge is distributed on the surface of the sphere, because the positively charged particles move freely toward the sphere’s interior.
The net charge is distributed uniformly throughout the sphere, because negatively charged particles move randomly through the sphere, resulting in an equal distribution, on average, of the charge.

The net charge is distributed uniformly throughout the sphere, because negatively charged particles added to the sphere will arrange themselves in the configuration with the highest degree of symmetry.

content.answer: The excess charge is distributed on the surface of the sphere, because negatively charged particles’ mutual repulsion causes them to move to the surface.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
